info.headline: Frost Advisory issued April 08 at 9:31PM EDT until April 09 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM EDT SATURDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 33 to 35 degrees will result in frost formation. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low 30 to 32 degrees are possible. * WHERE...Alexander, Catawba, Greater Burke and Eastern McDowell Counties in the North Carolina foothills and western Piedmont. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, from 2 AM to 9 AM EDT Saturday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Saturday night through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops and other sensitive vegetation, and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
